intro: Melandrium gillettii, commonly known as the Gillett's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branched. Melandrium gillettii is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
